info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 2:17PM MST until January 08 at 12:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches at lower elevations and 10 to 20 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph on Friday, leading to near blizzard conditions. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Thursday to Midnight MST Friday Night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
